pageContext.claim: “As I have stated strongly before, and just to reiterate, if Turkey does anything that I, in my great and unmatched wisdom, consider to be off limits, I will totally destroy and obliterate the Economy of Turkey (I've done before!). They must, with Europe and others, watch over the captured ISIS fighters and families. The U.S. has done far more than anyone could have ever expected, including the capture of 100% of the ISIS Caliphate. It is time now for others in the region, some of great wealth, to protect their own territory. THE USA IS GREAT!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump imposed sanctions on Turkey to pressure for the release of Andrew Brunson, but it did not wipe out Turkey's economy.  Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan shrugged them off and imposed reciprocal sanctions on US officials: "Those who think that they can make Turkey take a step back with ridiculous sanctions have never known this country or this nation." Brunson was eventually released.
